trans-unit.source: Enable device protection rule in compliance policy | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Enable device protection rule in compliance policy | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Enable mobile threat protection rule in the device compliance policy.
trans-unit.target: Enable mobile threat protection rule in the device compliance policy.

trans-unit.source: Enable device threat protection rule in the compliance policy
trans-unit.target: Enable device threat protection rule in the compliance policy

trans-unit.source: Intune with Lookout mobile threat protection gives you the ability to detect mobile threats and make a risk assessment on the device.
trans-unit.target: Intune with Lookout mobile threat protection gives you the ability to detect mobile threats and make a risk assessment on the device.

trans-unit.source: Compliance policy rule allows you to use this risk assessment to determine if the device is compliant with your policy.
trans-unit.target: Compliance policy rule allows you to use this risk assessment to determine if the device is compliant with your policy.

trans-unit.source: You can then use the conditional access policy to allow or block to Exchange, SharePoint, and other services based on device compliance.
trans-unit.target: You can then use the conditional access policy to allow or block to Exchange, SharePoint, and other services based on device compliance.

trans-unit.source: To have Lookout MTP threat detection influence the compliance policy for the device:
trans-unit.target: To have Lookout MTP threat detection influence the compliance policy for the device:

trans-unit.source: The **Device Threat Protection** rule must be enabled on the compliance policy.
trans-unit.target: The **Device Threat Protection** rule must be enabled on the compliance policy.

trans-unit.source: The **Lookout Status** page in the Intune Admin console must show **Active**.
trans-unit.target: The **Lookout Status** page in the Intune Admin console must show **Active**.

trans-unit.source: See the [Enable Lookout MTP connection in Intune](enable-lookout-mtp-connection-in-intune.md) topic for more details and instructions on how to activate Lookout integration.
trans-unit.target: See the [Enable Lookout MTP connection in Intune](enable-lookout-mtp-connection-in-intune.md) topic for more details and instructions on how to activate Lookout integration.

trans-unit.source: Configure device threat protection rule
trans-unit.target: Configure device threat protection rule

trans-unit.source: Before creating the device threat protection rule in the compliancy policy, we recommend that you [set up your subscription with Lookout MTP](set-up-your-subscription-with-lookout-mtp.md), [enable Lookout connection in Intune](enable-lookout-mtp-connection-in-intune.md),and [configure the Lookout for work app](configure-and-deploy-lookout-for-work-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: Before creating the device threat protection rule in the compliancy policy, we recommend that you [set up your subscription with Lookout MTP](set-up-your-subscription-with-lookout-mtp.md), [enable Lookout connection in Intune](enable-lookout-mtp-connection-in-intune.md),and [configure the Lookout for work app](configure-and-deploy-lookout-for-work-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: The compliance rule is only enforced once the setup is completed.
trans-unit.target: The compliance rule is only enforced once the setup is completed.

trans-unit.source: To enable the device threat protection rule, you can either use an existing compliance policy or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: To enable the device threat protection rule, you can either use an existing compliance policy or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: As part of the Lookout MTP setup, in the [Lookout MTP console](https://aad.lookout.com), you created a policy that classifies various threats into high, medium and low levels.
trans-unit.target: As part of the Lookout MTP setup, in the [Lookout MTP console](https://aad.lookout.com), you created a policy that classifies various threats into high, medium and low levels.

trans-unit.source: In the Intune compliance policy you will use the threat level to set the maximum allowed threat level.
trans-unit.target: In the Intune compliance policy you will use the threat level to set the maximum allowed threat level.

trans-unit.source: In the Intune administrator console, in the compliance policy page, go to **Device Health** and enable the **Device Threat Protection** rule using the toggle option.
trans-unit.target: In the Intune administrator console, in the compliance policy page, go to **Device Health** and enable the **Device Threat Protection** rule using the toggle option.

trans-unit.source: Then select the maximum allowed threat level, which is one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Then select the maximum allowed threat level, which is one of the following:

trans-unit.source: **None (secured)**: This is the most secure.
trans-unit.target: **None (secured)**: This is the most secure.

trans-unit.source: This means that the device cannot have any threats.
trans-unit.target: This means that the device cannot have any threats.

trans-unit.source: If the device is detected as having any level of threats, it will be evaluated as non-compliant.
trans-unit.target: If the device is detected as having any level of threats, it will be evaluated as non-compliant.

trans-unit.source: **Low**: Device is evaluated as compliant if only low level threats are present.
trans-unit.target: **Low**: Device is evaluated as compliant if only low level threats are present.

trans-unit.source: Anything higher puts the device in a non-compliant status.
trans-unit.target: Anything higher puts the device in a non-compliant status.

trans-unit.source: **Medium**: Device is evaluated as compliant if the threats that are present on the device are low or medium level.
trans-unit.target: **Medium**: Device is evaluated as compliant if the threats that are present on the device are low or medium level.

trans-unit.source: If the device is detected to have high level threats, it is determined as non-compliant.
trans-unit.target: If the device is detected to have high level threats, it is determined as non-compliant.

trans-unit.source: **High**: This is the least secure.
trans-unit.target: **High**: This is the least secure.

trans-unit.source: Essentially, this allows all threat levels, and perhaps only useful if you using this solution only for reporting purposes.
trans-unit.target: Essentially, this allows all threat levels, and perhaps only useful if you using this solution only for reporting purposes.

trans-unit.source: screenshot showing the device threat protection rule setting in
trans-unit.target: screenshot showing the device threat protection rule setting in

trans-unit.source: screenshot showing the threat level option for the device threat protection rule setting
trans-unit.target: screenshot showing the threat level option for the device threat protection rule setting

trans-unit.source: If you create conditional access policies for O365 and other services, the above compliance evaluation is taken into consideration and non-compliant devices are blocked access until the threat is resolved.
trans-unit.target: If you create conditional access policies for O365 and other services, the above compliance evaluation is taken into consideration and non-compliant devices are blocked access until the threat is resolved.

trans-unit.source: You can see the compliance state of a device on the devices page of the Intune administrator console.
trans-unit.target: You can see the compliance state of a device on the devices page of the Intune administrator console.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the devices page in the Intune admin console showing the compliance status of a device
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the devices page in the Intune admin console showing the compliance status of a device
